H0.text: A pencil is the most likely item that is made from only one material.

H1.text: A bicycle is the item most likely made from only one material.

H2.text: A paper clip is the item most likely made from only one material.

H3.text: A pair of shoes is the most likely to be made from only one material.

A4.text: The most common material is steel or some other metal, but molded plastic is also used.

A5.text: Graphite pencils are made of a mixture of clay and graphite

A6.text: Solid graphite pencils are solid sticks of graphite and clay composite

A7.text: Virtually all professional racing bicycles now use carbon fibre frames.

A8.text: Recent versions use bamboo for the primary frame with glued metal connections and parts.

A9.text: Soles can be simple—a single material in a single layer—or they can be complex, with multiple structures or layers and materials.
